Sentencas: Perovskite oxides BaBi0.05Co0.95-yNbyO3-delta (BBCNy, 0 <= y <= 0.2) are synthesized and evaluated as potential cathode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Highly charged Nb5+ successfully stabilizes the cubic perovskite structure to room temperature with Nb substituting content y > 0.1.
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The phase structure, thermal expansion behavior, electrical conductivity and electrochemical performance of BBCNy with cubic phase are systematically studied.
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The samples exhibit excellent chemical compatibility with GDC and have sufficiently high electrical conductivities.
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the thermal expansion coefficients of BBCNy samples are nearly twice those of the most commonly used electrolyte materials YSZ and GDC, which is a major drawback for application in IT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The polarization resistances of BBCNy with y = 0.10, 0.15 and 0.20 on GDC electrolyte are 0.086, 0.079 and 0.107 Omega cm(2) at 700 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Even though the YSZ electrolyte membrane and GDC barrier layer are approximately 50 gm and 10 gm in thickness, the highest maximum power density (1.23W cm(-2)) of the single cell Ni-YSZIYSZIGDCIBBCNom is obtained at 750 degrees C. Good long-term stability of the single cell with BBCN0.15 cathode is also demonstrated.
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These results demonstrate that BBCNy perovskite oxides with cubic structure are very promising cathode materials for IT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells
Bismuth and niobium co-doped barium cobalt oxide as a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells
